metadata.query: One day I was reading about Nietzsche, and it was a very short book written by a very famous commentator on Nietzsche in Brazil. But I asked for that book. Could you give me some options for what that book might be?

subtopics: What is the title of a short book on Nietzsche written by a famous commentator from Brazil?
Who is the famous commentator from Brazil who wrote about Nietzsche?
What is the publication date of the short book on Nietzsche written by the commentator from Brazil?

web_searches.subtopic: What is the title of a short book on Nietzsche written by a famous commentator from Brazil?

sources.title: Human, All Too Human - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Style Unlike his first book , The Birth of Tragedy, which was written in essay style, Human, All Too Human is a collection of aphorisms, a style which Nietzsche would use in many of his subsequent works. The aphorisms of Human, All Too Human range from a few words to a few pages, but most are short paragraphs.

sources.title: Friedrich Nietzsche bibliography - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: A title not dated was composed during the same year as the title preceding it. Further information for many of the works listed below may be found at this site annotated within the time of their composition and this site (both depict Nietzsche's musical thought and development).

sources.title: Philosophy of Friedrich Nietzsche - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Nietzsche in c. 1875 Friedrich Nietzsche (1844-1900) developed his philosophy during the late 19th century. He owed the awakening of his philosophical interest to reading Arthur Schopenhauer 's Die Welt als Wille und Vorstellung ( The World as Will and Representation, 1819, revised 1844) and said that Schopenhauer was one of the few thinkers that he respected, dedicating to him his essay ...

sources.title: Por que Nietzsche é tão popular no Brasil - DW - 15/10/2024
sources.snippet: O diretor e roteirista Dimis Jean Soares tinha 15 anos quando leu Friedrich Nietzsche (1844-1900) pela primeira vez. O livro foi O nascimento da tragédia (1872), o primeiro dos 19 publicados em ...

sources.title: Nietzsche in Brazil | Brazil 247
sources.snippet: " From the year 2000 onwards, Nietzsche became 'popular' in Brazil ; he was exploited by the media, used by the means of communication, and appropriated by the publishing market," writes Scarlett Marton, a professor in the Philosophy Department at USP (University of São Paulo).
